A Google co-founder, 38-year-old Larry Page , will return to the chief executive's job he surrendered in 2001, while Eric Schmidt , 55, who has run the company since then, will become executive chairman. Adult supervision no longer needed, Eric Schmidt tweeted about the change. He will instead do what executive chairpersons do, which is show up whenever asked and try to be helpful.
